snippet: The antiquated and inefficient way police officers have to communicate arrest information is like a game of telephone, in which the message is ultimately garbled.
abstract: Op-Ed article by law student Steven Cohen calls attention to problem of delays in criminal cases, which result in excessively lenient plea bargains and dismissals; outlines ways in which technology can replace antiquated, paper-based systems that contribute to slow progress of criminal cases.
lead_paragraph: The antiquated and inefficient way police officers have to communicate arrest information is like a game of telephone, in which the message is ultimately garbled.
